Major_Arcs.title: Introduction and Initial Conflicts in Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the main character Nan, her nostalgic feelings, and the initial conflicts surrounding the Ghost Town, including personal disagreements and the looming threat of modern development.

sub_scenes.title: Nostalgia and Saloon Disagreement
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the main character's longing for the past and a contrasting modern romantic conflict regarding visiting the Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and Woman's Nostalgia
Bar Conversation and Ghost Town Disagreement

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town Arrival and Airport Plan Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Nan journeys to the Ghost Town and overhears a conversation revealing the impending destruction of the town for airport development, creating a central conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Solo Ride to Ghost Town
Modern Visitors and Airport Development Plan
Nan Overhears the Airport Plan and Reacts

Major_Arcs.title: Emotional Turmoil and Confrontation at Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's emotional reactions to the Ghost Town's fate, her internal reflections on past relationships, and a dangerous confrontation with construction workers.

sub_scenes.title: Past Relationship Reflection
sub_scenes.description: Nan reflects on a past relationship with Cal, triggered by her distress over the Ghost Town, highlighting her romantic vulnerabilities.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal

sub_scenes.title: Construction Worker Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Nan directly confronts the construction workers at the Ghost Town, leading to a physical and dangerous altercation.

Major_Arcs.title: Business Dealings and Father-Daughter Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details business discussions surrounding the airport development, focusing on Nan's father's disapproval of her actions and the escalating conflict between them.

sub_scenes.title: Airport Business and Father's Opposition
sub_scenes.description: Business talk about the airport development ensues, complicated by Nan's father's opposition and Nan's frustration.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of Horses and Father's Disapproval

Major_Arcs.title: Conflicting Advice and Nan's Pursuit of Cal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Nan receiving conflicting advice from family and staff, leading to her decisive action to seek out Cal for answers about their relationship.

sub_scenes.title: Conflicting Perspectives on Love and Action
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives varied advice from her mother, father, and maid regarding her relationship with Cal and her emotional state.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Determination and Pursuit of Cal

sub_scenes.title: Business Obligations Intervene
sub_scenes.description: Nan's personal pursuits are interrupted by business obligations as a cowboy urgently reminds her of her horse rental commitments for the airport construction.

narrative_arcs.title: Business Deal with Cowboys and Urgency

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Ultimatum and Cal's Departure
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Nan's confrontation with Cal regarding their relationship and business, leading to a tense ultimatum and Cal's subsequent departure.

sub_scenes.title: Ultimatum and Defiance
sub_scenes.description: Nan delivers an ultimatum to Cal, linking their relationship to the horse business, but Cal defies her wishes, choosing his father's orders.

sub_scenes.title: Time Skip and Loneliness leading to Confession
sub_scenes.description: Time passes, and Nan experiences growing loneliness, leading her to overcome her hesitation and pursue Cal to confess her feelings.

Major_Arcs.title: Weather Crisis and Community Response
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to a sudden and severe weather crisis, interrupting Nan and Cal's personal issues and showcasing the community's response and collective action.

sub_scenes.title: Confession Interrupted by Weather Warning
sub_scenes.description: Nan's confession to Cal is abruptly interrupted by a weather warning, shifting the narrative focus to an external crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Community Concern and Action Plan
sub_scenes.description: The community reacts to the severe weather, expressing concern for their cattle and initiating plans to address the crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Fleeting Hope, and Fodder Relief
sub_scenes.description: The community experiences despair and a brief moment of hope as the snow stops, only to be followed by renewed snowfall and then unexpected relief with the arrival of a fodder plane.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: The Fodder Plane
Assessing the Situation and Lingering Concerns

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction and Conflicting Opinions of Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the character Chane Benson and presents varied perspectives on his dangerous yet captivating persona and violent methods.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Forceful Introduction
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is introduced through a display of force, knocking a man down in a western town, immediately establishing his character.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dangerous Casanova's Display of Force

sub_scenes.title: Conflicting Perspectives on Benson's Character
sub_scenes.description: Characters discuss Chane Benson, presenting conflicting views on his heroism, manners, and reliance on violence versus civilized methods.

narrative_arcs.title: Conflicting Views on Chane Benson's Heroism and Manners
Beyond Brute Force: Maturity and Civilization

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Family Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers around concerns about Jeff's unhealthy fascination with guns, leading to confrontations with his mother and others regarding his behavior.

sub_scenes.title: Childhood Hero Worship and Gun Concern
sub_scenes.description: Conversations reveal Jeff's past hero worship and present concerns about his unhealthy obsession with guns and violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing about Brother Jeff's Childhood Hero Worship

sub_scenes.title: Mother's Confrontation and Intervention
sub_scenes.description: Jeff is directly confronted by his mother and others about his gun handling, leading to emotional appeals and escalating tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Initiating a Talk about Jeff's Gun Handling
Mother's Disappointment and Desire for Decency
Comparison to Chane Benson and Criticism of Clyde Surrett
Defense of Chane Benson and Mocking Duel with Clyde Surrett

sub_scenes.title: Mother and Clyde's Resolve to Guide Jeff
sub_scenes.description: The mother and Clyde resolve to guide Jeff away from Benson's negative influence, expressing love, responsibility, and hope for the future.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance and Shared Responsibility for Jeff's Upbringing
Affection and Hope for Future Happiness

Major_Arcs.title: Rising Tension and Benson's Sinister Presence
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts escalating tension as Jeff goes missing, and introduces Chane Benson's unsettling demeanor and manipulative influence, foreshadowing trouble.

sub_scenes.title: Narrative Foreshadowing and Jeff's Absence
sub_scenes.description: Narrative reflection foreshadows trouble as Jeff goes missing, setting up a sense of impending conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Blissful Ignorance and Looming Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Benson's Advice and Demeanor
sub_scenes.description: Sally introduces Mr. Benson and his advice, while the narrative voice describes Benson's unsettling and deadly demeanor.

narrative_arcs.title: Advice from Mr. Benson to Sally
Chane Benson's Cold Demeanor and Silent Observation
Rejection of Brother's Influence and Disdain for Young Boys

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation and Newspaper's Stance Against Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts a direct confrontation with Chane Benson, where Surrett questions his intentions and Clyde asserts the newspaper's opposition to him and killers in town.

sub_scenes.title: Direct Confrontation with Benson
sub_scenes.description: Surrett confronts Benson, questioning his motives, and Benson gives an evasive and challenging reply.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Questioning of Benson's Intentions
Benson's Evasive Response and Assertion of Staying
Clyde's Intervention and Warning to Benson

sub_scenes.title: Private Concerns and Clyde's Resolve
sub_scenes.description: Surrett and Clyde discuss Benson privately, expressing concerns and Clyde reaffirming his determination to fight against him through the newspaper.

narrative_arcs.title: Surrett's Further Inquiry and Clyde's Resolve to Stay
Clyde's Declaration of Action and Protection

Major_Arcs.title: Sally's Dinner Invitation and Benson's Manipulation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Sally's attempt to use courtesy to influence Benson, but it backfires as Benson manipulates Jeff and creates a tense dinner confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation Strategy
sub_scenes.description: Sally proposes inviting Chane Benson to dinner as a way to de-escalate the tension, and Jeff is swayed by her faith in courtesy.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Benson and Dinner Invitation
Narrative Reflection on Decency and Courtesy
Narrative Time Skip and Jeff's Shift in Viewpoint

sub_scenes.title: Tense Dinner and Shooting Demonstration
sub_scenes.description: At dinner, Benson's manipulative influence over Jeff is evident as he performs a shooting demonstration, causing Sally concern.

narrative_arcs.title: Dinner Shooting Demonstration and Sally's Concern

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner's Aftermath: Accusations, Kisses, and Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers the aftermath of the dinner, featuring escalating tensions, forced affection, and Sally's clear rejection of Benson's manipulative advances.

sub_scenes.title: Moonlight Flirtation and Accusations
sub_scenes.description: Following dinner, tensions rise as Jeff and Benson accuse Sally of ulterior motives, and Benson attempts flirtation.

Major_Arcs.title: Physical Fight and Jeff's Transformation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the escalation of tension into a physical fight between Jeff and Benson, Jeff's injury, and his subsequent transformation driven by determination to save Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Fight and Sally's Reaction
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and Benson engage in a physical fight, leading to Jeff's injury and Sally's alarmed reaction and concern.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane Benson's Provocation and Jeff's Anger
Sally's Urgency and the Escape Plan

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Determined Escape and Armed Standoff
sub_scenes.description: Jeff escapes and transforms into a determined figure, leading to an armed confrontation with Chane Benson.

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Victory and Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Jeff's victory over Benson in a fistfight, leading to Benson's departure and a sense of resolution and future hope for Jeff, Sally, and Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Verbal Duel and Agreed Fight
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and Benson agree to a fistfight, setting aside their guns to resolve their conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Headline Change and Relief at Return

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Tensions and Introduction of Steve Daley
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces new characters and ranch-related conflicts, focusing on Steve Daley's arrival and the initial signs of trouble at the Double Bar Night ranch.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Fight and New Hire Introduction
sub_scenes.description: A physical fight occurs on the ranch, followed by the introduction of Steve Daley as a new hire.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and the Boss
Explanation of Steve's Hiring and Approval

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Concerns and Town Trip
sub_scenes.description: Steve helps with accommodations, and ranch concerns about a potential range war and missing cattle are discussed, leading to a trip to town.

Major_Arcs.title: Town Confrontation and Long Lady's Skill
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Long Lady in town, where she faces skepticism and then a direct physical threat, showcasing her unexpected combat skills.

sub_scenes.title: Store Visit and Skeptical Observation
sub_scenes.description: Long Lady visits a store, observed with skepticism by Fred Bridges and a hired hand, who doubt Steve Daley's judgment.

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Skillful Defense
sub_scenes.description: Long Lady is threatened by antagonists but swiftly defends herself, surprising onlookers with her combat abilities.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Management and Budding Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Betsy asserting her ranch management decisions, leading to a romantic development with Steve Daley as they navigate ranch troubles.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Firm Ranch Decisions
sub_scenes.description: Betsy makes firm decisions about ranch management, asserting her authority and stance against gunmen.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Conflict and Resolution with Steve
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve confront the conflict of his profession, leading to confessions of love and a resolution where Steve agrees to give up gunfighting.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love and the Dilemma of Profession

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Confrontation and Steve's Past
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new ranch confrontation and shifts to Steve's internal reflections on past mistakes and the events leading to the current crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Trespassing and Business Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Bridges and his men confront Betsy about trespassing and missing cattle, leading to rising tensions and direct conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Bridges and his Men

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Past Reflections
sub_scenes.description: Steve reflects on his past mistakes and events that have shaped his current situation, hinting at a deeper backstory.

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass Showdown and Romantic Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc culminates in a violent showdown at Devil's Pass, followed by Betsy and Steve's emotional reconciliation and romantic resolution amidst the conflict's aftermath.

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Decision for Violence and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Steve decides to arm himself and confront the threat at Devil's Pass, despite Betsy's pleas for peace, leading to his departure.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Decision to Arm Himself and Go to Devil's Pass
Betsy's Realization and Pursuit of Steve

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Gunfight and Betsy's Shock
sub_scenes.description: Steve confronts the gunslinger at Devil's Pass, leading to a violent gunfight where Betsy arrives and is caught in the crossfire, fainting from shock.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Initial Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Dave, Carrie, and Fred's Triangle and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a love triangle between Dave, Carrie, and Fred, exploring jealousy, misunderstandings, and ultimately leading to romantic resolutions and new beginnings.

sub_scenes.title: Argument and Troubling Ranch News
sub_scenes.description: An argument regarding 'Dave' and a woman occurs, followed by news of trouble at the ranch involving range disputes.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubling News at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Range Conflict and Expulsion
sub_scenes.description: A range conflict escalates as intruders are confronted and ultimately expelled from the ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion Among Intruders and Threat of Gunplay

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Brotherly Matters
sub_scenes.description: Dave and Carrie reconcile, discussing past behaviors and brotherly matters, leading to a seemingly positive shift in their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Fred and Brotherly Matters
Carrie's Introspective Thoughts on Love and Anticipation
Intrusion and Questioning by Fred Gordon

sub_scenes.title: Misunderstandings and Marriage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Misunderstandings are addressed, leading to confessions of fondness and a marriage proposal amidst resolved conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Rebuttal and Declaration of Love
Desire for Reconciliation and Invitation for Relaxation
Carrie's Reflection on Love for Fred and His Qualities
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Marriage Proposal

Major_Arcs.title: Contract Conflict and Carrie's Independence
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details a conflict arising from the Carlton contract, leading to Carrie asserting her independence and resolving misunderstandings with Dave and Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Contract Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Dave about prioritizing the Carlton contract over her, leading to accusations and emotional outbursts.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusation of Deception and Plea of Love
Confrontation with Dave, Pete, and Fred

sub_scenes.title: Office Confrontation and Emotional Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Carlton directly, asserts her independence, and then finds emotional release and reconciliation with Dave and Fred.

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred's Romantic Realignment
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the romantic realignment between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, culminating in Carrie and Fred's reunion and Dave's acceptance.

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Reflection and Dave's Inquiry
sub_scenes.description: Fred reflects on Carrie's words, and Dave encounters Carrie, questioning her feelings for Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Chance Encounter and Emotional Inquiry in Town

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Sickbed and Fred's Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Carrie is unwell, and a visit reveals the truth about the beef contract, leading to an emotional reunion with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Young Man's Confession and Carrie's Initial Reaction
Carrie's Flashback of Shame, Regret, and Happiness

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Showdown and Chris's Choice
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the confrontation between Dirk and Rance, Chris's intervention, and the resolution of their love triangle amidst violence and difficult choices.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Wounded Arrival and Childhood History
sub_scenes.description: Dirk arrives wounded, and Carrie tends to him, reflecting on their shared childhood and his past injuries.

sub_scenes.title: Old Man's Concern and Rance Cready's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: The old man expresses concern for Dirk and investigates, while Rance Cready arrives at the ranch seeking the Marshal.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Encounter with Chris Ransome
Escalating Tension and Accusation at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Marshal and Dirk's Brother's Conflict and Negotiation
sub_scenes.description: The Marshal is revealed to be involved in the conflict with Dirk and his brother, leading to a negotiation for Dirk's custody and care.

narrative_arcs.title: Negotiation for Dirk's Custody and Care
Lawman's Internal Conflict and Shifting Perspective

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confessions and Chris's Deception
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance confess their love, but Chris's underlying plan to help Dirk escape is revealed, leading to Rance's rejection.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Desire and Lingering Doubt
Realization of Rejection and Internal Conflict
Confrontation about Intentions and Daybreak Departure

sub_scenes.title: Chase, Shootout, and Reunion in Mexico
sub_scenes.description: A chase ensues, leading to a violent shootout, Chris's intervention, and ultimately Rance and Dirk's reunion in Mexico.

narrative_arcs.title: Justification for Deadly Force and Injury Assessment
Desperate Escape Plan and Moral Objection
Parting Ways and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Marriage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Rance is found injured but recovers under care, leading to emotional confessions and a marriage proposal between Chris and Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Sleepless Vigil and Lingering Danger
Father's Tactful Exit and Anticipation of Private Discussion
Clarification of Father's Integrity and Dirk's Involvement
Declaration of Gratitude and Undying Affection

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day Intrusion and Final Resolution
sub_scenes.description: On their wedding day, Dirk unexpectedly arrives, but it is revealed he comes in peace, offering a wedding gift, leading to a final celebratory resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Acclamation and Anecdotal Praise for Rance
